text: Those parents who do not educate their sons are their enemies; for as is a crane among swans, so are ignorant so are ignorant sons in a public assembly.
author: Chanakya

text: There is poison in the fang of the serpent, in the mouth of the fly and in the sting of a scorpion; but the wicked man is saturated with it.
author: Chanakya

text: Learn from the mistakes of others.
author: Chanakya

text: Education is the best friend. An educated person is respected everywhere. Education beats the beauty and the youth.
author: Chanakya

text: Even if a snake is not poisonous, it should pretend to be venomous.
author: Chanakya

text: Purity of speech, of the mind, of the senses, and of a compassionate heart are needed by one who desires to rise to the divine platform.
author: Chanakya

text: O wise man! Give your wealth only to the worthy and never to others. The water of the sea received by the clouds is always sweet.
author: Chanakya

text: We should not fret for what is past, nor should we be anxious about the future; men of discernment deal only with the present moment.
author: Chanakya

text: The biggest Guru mantra is: never share your secrets with anybody. It will destroy you.
author: Chanakya

text: Those base men who speak of the secret faults of others destroy themselves like serpents that stray onto anthills.
author: Chanakya

text: Test a servant while in the discharge of his duty, a relative in difficulty, a friend in adversity, and a wife in misfortune.
author: Chanakya

text: He who befriends a man whose conduct is vicious, whose vision impure, and who is notoriously crooked, is rapidly ruined.
author: Chanakya

text: What good can the scriptures do to a man who has no sense of his own? Of what use is as mirror to a blind man?
author: Chanakya

text: When one is consumed by the sorrows of life, three things give him relief: offspring, a wife, and the company of the Lord's devotees.
author: Chanakya

text: Swans live wherever there is water, and leave the place where water dries up; let not a man act so - and comes and goes as he pleases.
author: Chanakya

text: Skills are called hidden treasure as they save like a mother in a foreign country.
author: Chanakya

text: The one excellent thing that can be learned from a lion is that whatever a man intends doing should be done by him with a whole-hearted and strenuous effort.
author: Chanakya

text: Treat your kid like a darling for the first five years. For the next five years, scold them. By the time they turn sixteen, treat them like a friend. Your grown up children are your best friends.
author: Chanakya

text: God doesn't dwell in the wooden, stony or earthen idols. His abode is in our feelings, our thoughts.
author: Chanakya

text: There is no austerity equal to a balanced mind, and there is no happiness equal to contentment; there is no disease like covetousness, and no virtue like mercy.
author: Chanakya

text: There is some self-interest behind every friendship. There is no friendship without self-interests. This is a bitter truth.
author: Chanakya

text: The biggest guru-mantra is: never share your secrets with anybody. It will destroy you.
author: Chanakya

text: Good behavior wins even an enemy.
author: Chanakya

text: He who nurtures benevolence for all creatures within his heart overcomes all difficulties and will be the recipient of all types of riches at every step.
author: Chanakya

text: It is better to die than to preserve this life by incurring disgrace. The loss of life causes but a moment's grief, but disgrace brings grief every day of one's life.
author: Chanakya

text: The life of an uneducated man is as useless as the tail of a dog which neither covers its rear end, nor protects it from the bites of insects.
author: Chanakya

text: A man is born alone and dies alone; and he experiences the good and bad consequences of his karma alone; and he goes alone to hell or the Supreme abode.
author: Chanakya

text: The fragrance of flowers spreads only in the direction of the wind. But the goodness of a person spreads in all directions.
author: Chanakya

text: A man is born alone and dies alone and he experiences the good and bad consequences of his karma alone; and he goes alone to hell or the Supreme abode.
author: Chanakya
